results.title: The Pilgrim
results.creator_credit: Richard Taylor, Barclays Bank and Richard Taylor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated film showing the pitfalls for unwary manufacturers wanting to export. Describes the services which banks offer which help exporters.

results.title: The Pig's wedding
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Smoke signals herald the impending marriage of pigs Porker and Curly Tail. The guests are busy cleaning, preening and painting on the perfect outfits, then it’s time for some serious eating, drinking and dancing, until rain threatens the celebrations.

results.title: The Pied piper of Hamelin: Cinderella
results.creator_credit: Mark Hall, Brian Cosgrove and Cosgrove-Hall Productions
results.brief_description: This tape includes two wonderful fairy tales featuring puppets from Cosgrove Hall studios. “The Pied piper of Hamelin”; set in the fourteenth century this story centres around the greedy councillors who reneg on a promise to pay the piper for ridding the township of rats. They pay dearly for their broken promise. Narrated by Robert Hardy with music composed by David Rohl and Stuart J. Wolstenholme. The presentation of “Cinderella” is based on the one by Perrault, with the unusual feature of being told through the music which was specially composed for the film. A spectacular blend of puppetry, animation, music and colour. Music is once again composed by David Rohl and Stuart J Wolstenholme.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Hall, Brian Cosgrove and Cosgrove-Hall Productions

They pay dearly for their broken promise. Narrated by Robert Hardy with music composed by David Rohl and Stuart J. Wolstenholme. The presentation of “Cinderella” is based on the one by Perrault, with the unusual feature of being told through the music which was specially composed for the film. A spectacular blend of puppetry, animation, music and colour. Music is once again composed by David Rohl and Stuart J Wolstenholme.

results.title: The Picture woman
results.creator_credit: Peter Rasmussen, Robert Reynolds, Victor Gentile, Australian Film Commission and Oracle Pictures
results.brief_description: A woman whose life has been photographed every day since birth looks back at her life and asks, “can a lifetime be embraced in one breath?”. (Awards: London Film Festival, 1998; Mill Valley Film Festival, 1998; Montreal Film Festival, 1998)

results.title: The Photographers
results.creator_credit: Jerry Sims, Christine Huneke and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description: Five of America’s top professional still photographers are seen here on assignments around the world. Includes Larry Burrows, Alfred Eisenstaedt, Mary Ellen Mark, John Dominis and Norman Parkinson.

results.title: The Photographer
results.brief_description: A whimsical sketch of a photographer in a small community, whose livelihood comes from understanding, and flattering, people’s vanities. As it presents a sampling of one day’s appointments, the film pokes gentle fun at the parade of human nature that passes before a photographer’s lens. Writen by Norman Klenman, photographed by Lorne C. Batchelor, narrated by William Hutt.
